title: 104_hr3759
content:
The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" is also known as the Overseas Private Investment Corporation Act. It amends income levels and sets a ceiling on investment insurance. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to increase the ceiling on investment insurance to $25 billion, financing to $20 billion, and issuing authority to 2001. Policy guidance is also addressed. SEC. 105 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to increase United States exports and complement trade policy. SEC. 106 establishes a Board of Directors. Section 233(b) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include the President of the Corporation, the Administrator of the Agency for International Development, and the United States Trade Representative as part of the Board of Directors. The United States Trade Representative may designate a Deputy to serve on the Board in place of the Representative. There shall be a Chairman and a Vice Chairman of the Board designated by the President from among the Directors. TITLE II--TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY

SEC. 201. TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AUTHORIZATION.

Section 661(f)(1)(A) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to authorize $40,000,000 for fiscal 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998.

TITLE III--EXPORT PROMOTION PROGRAMS WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL TRADE ADMINISTRATION

SEC. 301. EXPORT PROMOTION AUTHORIZATION. SEC. 301. EXPORT PROMOTION AUTHORIZATION. Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 is amended to authorize $240,000,000 for fiscal year 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998. Section 2312(c) of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 is amended to identify means for providing coordinated export promotion services to small- and medium-sized businesses and establish priorities for promoting US exports and free market reforms in the Middle East to stimulate job growth. SEC. 402. IMPLEMENTATION OF PRIMARY OBJECTIVES. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will identify and address overlap and duplication in Federal export promotion activities, promote coordination between State, Federal, and private sector export promotion efforts, and share market research data by September 30, 1997. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will address overlap and duplication in Federal export promotion activities, promote coordination between State, Federal, and private sector efforts, and share market research data by September 30, 1997. This information will be included in the annual report required under the Export Enhancement Act of 1988. SEC. 403. PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT IN THE UKRAINE. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will report on efforts to promote trade and investment for private sector development in Ukraine in the 1997 annual report.
